questions.text: What is the correction factor for temperature and pressure called in TG-51?
questions.explanation: kTP is the temperature-pressure correction factor in TG-51.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a type of radiation interaction with matter?
questions.explanation: Quantum tunneling is a quantum mechanical phenomenon, not a radiation interaction with matter.

questions.text: What is the HVL (Half-Value Layer) of a material?
options: The thickness that reduces the beam intensity by half
The thickness that allows half the beam to pass through
The time it takes for a radioactive material to decay by half
The voltage required to produce half the maximum x-ray intensity
questions.explanation: The Half-Value Layer (HVL) is the thickness of a material required to reduce the intensity of an x-ray or gamma-ray beam to half its original value.

questions.text: Which of the following detectors is based on the ionization of a gas?
questions.explanation: An ion chamber detects radiation by measuring the ionization of a gas.

questions.text: In external beam radiation therapy, what does PDD stand for?
questions.explanation: PDD stands for Percentage Depth Dose, which is the ratio of the absorbed dose at a given depth to the absorbed dose at a fixed reference depth.

questions.text: In MRI, what does the T1 relaxation time primarily depend on?
questions.explanation: T1 relaxation time (longitudinal relaxation) primarily depends on spin-lattice interactions, which is the energy transfer between spins and their surrounding molecular environment.

questions.text: Which of the following modalities does NOT use ionizing radiation?
questions.explanation: MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) uses strong magnetic fields and radio waves, not ionizing radiation.
